<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Interaction

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Disables or enables the keyboard and mouse input. Usually used during cutscenes.<br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Warning </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Be careful and responsible with the usage of this command. Once the user input is disabled, the only option left is to restart the game. Make sure you provide scripted mechanics to resolve this, should you need to disable user input for any reason.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''disableUserInput''' state

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> state: [[Boolean]] - [[true]] to disable, [[false]] to enable

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[disableUserInput]] [[true]];
// cutscene
[[disableUserInput]] [[false]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[userInputDisabled]], [[enableSimulation]], [[enableSimulationGlobal]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on 14 March 2014</dd>
<dt class="note>'''[[User:Killzone_Kid|Killzone_Kid]]'''
<dd class="note">
Sometimes, when [[disableUserInput]] [[true]] command is invoked while the user is holding a button, when [[disableUserInput]] [[false]] is called and the user is no longer holding the button, the input will resume as if the user is still holding the button. To reset this behaviour, disable and enable user input again in the same frame:
<code>[[disableUserInput]] [[true]];
//do something
[[disableUserInput]] [[false]];
[[disableUserInput]] [[true]];
[[disableUserInput]] [[false]];</code>
Unfortunately, if the user is moving mouse when [[disableUserInput]] [[true]] command is invoked, the mouse input will get stuck for the whole duration of disabled user input but will reset as soon as [[disableUserInput]] [[false]] is called. I was unable to find workaround for this one.
<br><br>
UPDATE: There is now [[userInputDisabled]] command, which allows one to check if user input is still disabled after enabling it, so that one can retry until enabling is successful.
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
